result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph R Bosse was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$15,744.72 to Steve O.
Bail on deposit to be held pending hearing May 19, 2015.
**5/19/2015 the 15,744.72 payable to Steven O.  Bail to apply.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) Wis. stats. Court also ordered that while on supervision, the defendant participate in a payment plan.  The monthly payments shall not be less than 20% of the defendant's gross earnings.  Failure to pay by the end of supervision will result in a civil judgment.

Pay all costs, fees and surcharges and restitution to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under SEc. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.   Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain employment of at least 30 hours per week or be a full time student, or part time student with employment of at least 30 hours per week.

No contact with the victim's family.
May not be present where controlled substances are used, packaged for sale, or sold.
To report prescriptions to agent before filling the prescription.
AODA assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety from all illegal drugs and alcohol.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never posssess any gun or other firearms; futher advised that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Attorney Thomas John Erickson in court, defendant Joseph R Bosse not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court ordered restitution in the amount of $15,744.72 payable to Steven O.  Restitution to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats. Court ordered that cash bail on deposit be applied to restitution. Court also ordered that while on supervision the Defendant participate in a payment plan. The monthly payments shall not be less than 20% of the Defendant's gross earnings. Failure to pay by the end of supervision will result in civil judgment.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Victim Impact Statement and restitution worksheet with attachments received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Letters (2) on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Letter on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Letter on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Joseph R Bosse in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Joseph R Bosse in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for return on warrant. Discussion regarding the defendant's non-appearance at the last court date. Arguments heard as to bail. Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody. Court did NOT forfeit the cash bail on deposit. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 4/21/15 at 11:44 a.m. Bench warrant in file. Parties notified. Case adjourned to 4/23/15 at 1:30 p.m. for Return on Warrant in Branch 25. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Thomas John Erickson in court.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
NO FILE IN COURT. Case set for sentencing hearing. Defendant does not appear in court. Defense counsel was advised by the defendant's mother that the defendant would not appear in court this morning. State requested a warrant be issued. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court will defer ruling on forfeiture of bail until the return of the warrant.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Letter on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Victim Impact Statement with attached restitution information received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Cover letter with attached letters on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Received and Filed, Private PSI report requested by Attorney Erickson including Curriculum Vitae and cover letter.
As to COUNT 2- Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 dismissed but read-in for purposes of sentencing.
Arguments heard as to bail. Court ordered the Justice Point point monitoring be increased to Enhanced Supervision. All other conditions of bail remain the same.

Defendant Joseph R Bosse in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded.

Defendant sworn in.
As to COUNT 1-
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Defense counsel will be submitting a private PSI prior to sentencing. Defendant to give a DNA sample following today's proceedings. Court vacated jury trial date of 3/09/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25. Sentencing Hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Defendant Joseph R Bosse in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared via telephone for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Branch 25 in trial and unable to hear this matter. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Court ordered this matter adjourned for projected plea. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 3/09/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Joseph R Bosse in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Branch 25 is unable to hear this matter. Defense counsel has received discovery from the State. Parties believe this matter will resolve prior to trial but do not have a firm resolution. Court ordered this matter be scheduled for final pretrial and jury trial dates. Parties to file motions by 12/02/14. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions and motions in limine by the final pretrial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

14RM050900  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
11-08-2014

Defendant Joseph R Bosse in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Joseph R Bosse in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for arraignment. State previously filed an amended information in Branch 15 on 10/06/14. The filing was not noted in CCAP. Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of the amended information filed 10/06/14. State filed a duplicate amended information in Branch 25 on 10/13/14.

Defense counsel acknowledges receipt of the amended information filed 10/13/14 and waived reading. Defendant pled not guilty as to both counts. Defense counsel has received most of the discovery. State anticipates receiving additional discovery and will turn the discovery to defense counsel. Joint request for adjourned scheduling date granted by the Court. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas John Erickson in court, defendant Joseph R Bosse not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for arraignment. Defendant was not produced. Branch 25 is unable to hear this matter. State filed an Amended Information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNT 1- First Degree Reckless Homicide (Delivery of Drugs - Len Bias Law),  contrary to sec. 940.02(2)(a), 939.50(3)(c) Wis. Stats., a Class C Felony.

COUNT 2 remains the same. Court will conduct arraignment at the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Arraignment scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas John Erickson in court, defendant Joseph R Bosse not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case is being amended to a homicide and assigned to Branch 25. Case calendared for ARRAIGNMENT on 10/13/2014 at 1:30 pm in Branch 25.

This case may be dismissed and reissued as a homicide. Case calendared for STATUS on 9/3/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.   State informs the Court it will take approximately ten weeks to obtain the toxicology reports.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph R Bosse in court with attorney Thomas J Erickson.  Defendant Joseph R Bosse in custody.  Paul Hauer for Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Arraignment scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.

Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
